dialogues.speaker: MAIN TITLE SEQUENCE 1
dialogues.text: In the middle of a black screen is a pumpkin. A jack-o-lantern. Two candles on either side cast a flickering orange glow on the carved, grinning face. CAMERA SLOWLY DOLLIES IN on the pumpkin. SUPERIMPOSE MAIN TITLES. Finally the pumpkin FILLS THE SCREEN. The final credit is SUPERIMPOSED. Then suddenly the pumpkin CRACKS OPEN from top to bottom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underneath the meat, pulp and seeds that pour out is a wet, gleaming skull!

dialogues.speaker: HADDONFIELD, ILLINOIS
dialogues.text: We HEAR a song. Over a radio. "Mister Sandman" by the Chordettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh, Mister Sandman, Send me a dream... Make her the cutest thing ‘That I've ever seen...

dialogues.text: The dark house. Quiet. Still. Then KABLAM! A FLASH OF LIGHT from the upstairs window! A GUNSHOTT” —_—_—_ ET ——EEEEEEEEEEOAEOEEOEEO

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE HOUSE 15
dialogues.text: Then FIVE MORE FLASHES OF LIGHT from upstairs! Accompanie by FIVE LOUD GUNBLASTS!”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second later. Just a glimpse. The figure of a man. Around the side of the house. Hurtling backwards off an upstairs balcony and falling into the back yard! 17

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOOR 19
dialogues.text: The open front door. Inside, darkness. Completely still. Suddenly DR. SAM LOOMIS pops out of the doorway! He is Mephistophelean figure in a goatee, bald head and trench coat fluttering in the wind. He carries a .357 magnum revolver. His eyes are blazing.

dialogues.speaker: ON LOOMIS, (PANAGLIDE)
dialogues.text: Loomis races off the porch and around the side of the house. Past bushes. Past a flowered trellis. Into the back yard. Which is empty. Loomis ends down over a flattened patch of grass.

dialogues.speaker: REVISED
dialogues.text: CLOSE oN GRASS , 21 Loomis! fingers search the grass. They touch something. He holds up his fingers. The tips are covered with blood.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS, (PANAGLIDE)
dialogues.text: Loomis stands up. He looks wildly around the back yard. Then he moves. back around the house to the front. CAMERA PANAGLIDES WITH HIM. Next door a porch light comes on. A MAN in pajamas storms out of his house.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN PAJAMAS
dialogues.text: What's goin' on out here? Loomis spins around.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Call the police. Tell Sheriff Brackett I've shot him.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN PAJAMAS
dialogues.text: Who? .

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Tell him he's still loose!

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN PAJAMAS
dialogues.text: Is this some kinda joke? I've been trick or treated to death tonight.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: You don't know what death is. Loomis suddenly turns away, rushes across the lawn and off down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANAGLIDES DOWN a small alley through someone's POV. MOVING FAST. Running. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: < We HEAR a breathing sound. A GASPING BREATH muffled : against a rubber mask Hurtling down the alley. Suddenly a black dog leaps out of the darkness straight at the CAMERA. Growling. Baring its teeth. But restrained by a long cord. tethered aroun its neck. : A porch light goes on. A back door opens. A MAN comes out and yells at his dog.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Ralph! Shuddup! The POV turns and runs away. Down the alley. Past trash cans and garage doors. Around a corner to the side of a house. The POV stops. Then moves forward again. Slowly. Up to the edge of the front porch. We see a street. Trees WHISHING in the wind. Leaves blowing. ’ A group of CHILDREN trick or treating, escorted by TWO i] OLDER WOMEN, walk jauntily away down a sidewalk. GIGGLING AND SINGING. Then the POV watches a figure come out of the shadows. it is Loomis. The POV pulls back slightly. Hiding behind some bushes. A pair of headlights swings around and hits Loomis. A Highway Patrol car SCREECHES to a stop. Sheriff LEIGH BRACKETT gets out. He carries a shotgun. Loomis moves over to him.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: I shot him six times!

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT
dialogues.text: (points to . Loomis' gun) That thing would have blown him in two...

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: I fired into his heart. He wouldn't die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brackett looks at Loomis for a beat. Then both men glance up and down the street. And move for the patrol car. :

dialogues.speaker: BRACKET
dialogues.text: He can't have gotten too far. They get in and the patrol car ROARS away down the street. The SIREN fades to a distant WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls back from the bushes. Back to the house. For a moment into black. - Then the POV swings up to a window. Moves closer. Peers inside. Through the blowing curtains we see a MAN watching TV. A black and white movie is on. "Night of the ee Dead", The scene at the front porch. The hero hts a molotov cocktail and tosses it at the ghouls. They recoil from the flames. The POV moves from the window. Along the side of the house. To a large kitchen window. Which is open. SLOWLY, carefully, the POV looks inside.
MRS. ELROD is standing over a butcher block making a sandwich. She slices some ham with a large butcher knife. Then she goes over to the refrigerator, takes out a large jar of mayonnaise.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ELROD
dialogues.text: Harold, you want mayonnaise on your sandwich? No response. She goes back to the counter and begins slathering mayo all over the sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ELROD
dialogues.text: (continuing) What about mustard? Still no response. Leaving the sandwich unfinished, she goes over to the doorway and looks in. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ELROD
dialogues.text: (continuing) Harold? You asleep again?’ She moves further into the room. Her husband is asleep in front of the set. Now we HEAR the sounds of the movie stop anda bulletin comes over the air.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We interrupt our movie for a WWAR News Update. Here live is a report from WWAR's own Robert Mundy... QUICKLY the POV opens the screen door to the kitchen and slips inside.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (continuing) «+. The State Police has issued an all-points bulletin for Michael Myers, a mental patient who escaped last night from Smith's Grove-Warren County Sanitarium. He is now believed to be at large in Haddonfield... Mrs. Elrod stands watching the bulletin with interest. Behind her, we see the shape step into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The POV'S blocd-caked hand reaches in the kitchen window, grasps a ps a butcner knife from the counter 7 and pulis out into the darkness. Mrs. Elrod hears something and spins around. She sees a flash of the shape disappearing into the darkness. She sees the drops of blood lying on the butcher block beside her ham sandwich. She opens her mouth and - SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREAMING OF A SIREN.
dialogues.text: The ambulance from the clinic WHINES past the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREAMING OF ANOTHER SIREN.
dialogues.text: A Highway Patrol car SCREECHES to a stop in front of the Doyle house. Two other Highway Patrol cars are already there. And an ambulance. Lights flashing. Radios SQUAWKING. A CROWD is gathered around the front door. PATROLMEN, NEIGHBORS, ON-LOOKERS. CAMERA STARTS TO MOVE. Toward the house.

ee CONTINUED: © 25 CAMERA REACHES the front door. JIMMY, 21, and BUDD, 24, two medics, appear. Carrying a stretcher. As they hurry down the front walk CAMERA MOVES IN CLOSER. Lying on the stretcher is LAURIE STRODE. Seventeen. Pretty. Long brown hair. She is in a numb pain. Cry- ing. Covered with a blanket. CAMERA MOVES WITH the stretcher to the ambulance. Laurie is lifted into the back. Jimmy jumps inside with her. Budd closes the doors with a SLAM! curT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careening down a street. SIREN GOING. Budd is at the wheel. He listens to. the car radio.

dialogues.speaker: . ANNOUNCER, (V.O. RADIO)
dialogues.text: .-».reports of at least one violent attack tonight by the escaped mental patient. A teenage girl was found minutes ago in the upstairs hallway of a Haddonfield residence... Budd turns and talks through the open port to the rear of the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: BUDD
dialogues.text: It's all over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: REAR OF AMBULANCE 27
dialogues.text: Laurie lies on the stretcher. Jimmy kneels over her. Pulls back the shredded arm of her blouse. Wraps a bandage around a long slash wound now blackened with dried blood.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Laurie... Laurie stares at Jimmy, not really seeing him, tears streaming down her face. LAURIE . Don't... let them put me to sleep... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: It's okay now, We're going to the clinic...

dialogues.speaker: -LAURIE
dialogues.text: Promise me! You won't let them put me to sleep...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Easy, now. Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: He'll... find me if I sleep... Jimmy leans forward through the open port to Budd. '

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: BUDD
dialogues.text: You know this chick?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Laurie Strode. She goes to school with Ziggy.

dialogues.speaker: BUDD
dialogues.text: Her old man Strode Realty?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ON BUDD 28
dialogues.text: He turns back to the road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BUDD
dialogues.text: That means old Budd don't let up on the hammer!

dialogues.text: A long, two-story building 1s surrounded by a large, asphalt parking lot. A few cars are parked under mereury vapor lights. A door is marked: EMERGENCY ENTRANCE. A station wagon pulls into the parking lot. Right up to the emergency entrance. The WOMAN DRIVER slams on her brakes. Next to her is GARY, a 10-year-old dressed as a pirate, holding a bloody towel to his mouth. His CRIES of pain are muffled through the towel. His mother leans over and helps him out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Just hold on, honey. Gary yanks the towel from his face. He gingerly reaches in and picks at a razor blade stuck to the roof of his mouth. 7 His mother quickly pushes the towel back up to his mouth. MOTHER ‘ (continuing) Keep it up there! Don't touch it! . A SIREN RISES. From a distance. LOUDER AND LOUDER. The ambulance pulls into the parking lot. Whizzes past Mother and Gary. ROARS to a stop by the emergency en- trance. Mother ushers Gary quickly toward the doors.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof of the ambulance. Then the rear doors open. Jimmy and Budd lean into VIEW and slowly pull the gurney out. “The mercury vapor lights flare. Laurie's arms raise up into CAMERA, across her face, shielding her eyes from the light. Jimmy reaches in and gently pulls her arms down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: \ She recoils from the lights. The gurney is pulled along. Through the glass doors. Into the clinic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Budd loom over Laurie. They wheel her down the hallway. oe JILL, a nurse in her 20s, pops her head into FRAME. a She stares down at Laurie.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Where's Doctor Mixter?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (whispers conspiratorily) The party at the country club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: JILL

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: It's Laurie Stro...

dialogues.speaker: BUDD
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah... Jesus Christ, let's go! . io

dialogues.text: Budd and Jimmy wheel Laurie past a nurse's station and into a room. Jill follows them in. From another hallway DOCTOR comes walking up. Middle- aged. With very red eyes. He pulls on his white coat. MRS. ALVES, a stern 50-year-old RN, hands him a styrofoam cup of coffee. Doctor gulps the coffee and pops several aspirin from a bottle. Then he and Mrs. Alves hurry into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An IV needle slides wickedly into her vein.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: She winces in pain. Looks up. LAURIE'S POV - DOCTOR ‘ 39 Doctor Mixter hovers above her. Preparing a hypo- dermic.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You've lost a lot of blood. We need to type it. Mrs. Alves hands him a syringe. He bends down over Laurie, but his hands shake badly.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Janet, get me some more coffee.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE'S OTHER ARM 4O
dialogues.text: The needle jabs into her skin and blood spurts into the syringe. When the vial is full, the Doctor removes it.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: When was the last time you had a tetanus shot?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: (dazed) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Within the last three years? Laurie shrugs.
ANOTHER ANGLE » AL The Doctor moves up to Laurie's shoulder and rrobes the wound. Laurie winces in pain. Janet comes back. Hands a cup of coffee to Doctor Mixter.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Thanks. (to Mrs. Alves) I want four dozen sutures, and ‘we're gonna have to put her out. CLOSE ON LAURIE ‘yo Her face registers fear.

dialogues.speaker: _LAURIE
dialogues.text: No, don't put me to sleep. DOCTOR . I want to take care of that shoulder of yours, Laurie. This way you won't feel any pain.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You'll wake up in.a little while.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Laurie. CLOSE ON DOCTOR ay Doctor Mixter continues to administer the sodium pen- tothal.

dialogues.text: Jill bends down and pulls Laurie's blue jeans off.  46 47 48 49 50 51
“CLOSE - LAURIE'S BLOUSE : 46 Mrs. Alves’ fingers undo the buttons. Then RIP the rest of the blouse away.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY 48
dialogues.text: Budd and Jimmy stand in the doorway. Watching. CLOSE - MRS. ALVES 4g Looks up sharply.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ALVES
dialogues.text: You two get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE 50
dialogues.text: The effect of the drug begins to. take hold. Her eye- lids droop. ,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREMELY WIDE LENS. Shoot at 30 frames per second. The SOUND slowly distorts, Like hearing everything from inside a fishbowl. Hollow and siowed-~down slightly. Doctor, Mrs. Alves and Jill hover nearby. Beyond them, the doorway. The nurse's station right outside. Budd, Janet and Jimmy in the hall. Mother and Gary step into VIEW. Gary still holds the towel to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (to Jimmy) We've been here ten minutes. Suddenly Jill's face.moves down into VIEW, filling the SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Try to relax, Laurie. Doctor Mixter will have you stitched up in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes flittering. Trying to concentrate. To stay awake. Losing the battle.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper) Can't sleep now... Finally her eyes close and she falls back on the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: SCREECHING AROUND A CORNER.
dialogues.text: Brackett drives. He works his spotlight across the houses along the block. Loomis is in the seat next to him. He looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Circle the block again. a Brackett shoots a glance at Loomis, then makes the il turn.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT
dialogues.text: How long now?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Thirty minutes. (points) Put the light there. Along those trees. Brackett swings the spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT
dialogues.text: You know, Doctor, I think I'm there. Loomis looks at him. ©) BRACKETT ~ (continuing) The point where I stop taking orders from you. (CONTINUED)
ff oa 53

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: All right, sheriff. Whatever you want. Our primary concern is to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT
dialogues.text: You let him out... His own goddamn doctor... The two-way radio SQUAWKS. The VOICE is completely garbled by static. Brackett picks up his microphone.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT
dialogues.text: (continuing, into mike) Who was that? More GARBLED STATIC. As Brackett talks, Loomis reaches into his coat pocket and pulls out his revolver. He opens the chamber and clicks out the empty shells. Then he reaches into his other pocket and pulls out a handful of bullets. He carefully flicks them into their chambers.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT
dialogues.text: (continuing, into mike Say again. Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: HUNT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over radio) Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKET
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: HUNT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (over radio) Out by the bakery, moving north on the Scottsville Road...

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT
dialogues.text: Get the hell back into town! Come up 17th and meet me by the Bypass. As Brackett hangs up the microphone Loomis CLICKS the chamber closed,

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT

dialogues.text: Do you think I'm lying, sheriff. ‘

dialogues.text: I think you missed him. A . man couldn't take six shots...

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS

dialogues.speaker: BRACKETT

dialogues.text: Moving faster. Into the street. Toward a concrete retaining wall. Suddeniy. Around a corner. A patrol car. Lights flashing. SCREECHES. Swerves to avoid the masked figure. But hits him! KAWHAM! Head on! Scooping him uv on the front end!

dialogues.text: Loomis and Brackett press forward. Now several feet from the burning car. The PATROLMAN inside crawls out. Pulls himself along the pavement. Brackett helps him to his feet.

dialogues.text: They stare.

dialogues.text: (screams at Loomis )

dialogues.text: rackett looks at Hunt. Loomis continues to stare into the fire. Transfixed.

dialogues.text: Rettig was on the radio. They found ‘em right across the street from the Doyle ‘ house. Three kids. (a pause as he just looks at Brackett for a beat) One of them is Annie! dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: cracked a bone in her ankle. Plus that cut on her arm. She's gonna have a scar.

dialogues.speaker: . JANET
dialogues.text: Doctor gave her a double bullet. If she can keep her eyes open she's made out of steel. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: (Tv) +». and we're going to stay on the air now. Repeating, three people are dead tonight as the result of an attack by an escaped mental patient... Jill looks up at Jimmy.

dialogues.text: I believe it. But they're not telling about the drugs involved. Lots of drugs involved. Had to be. Jill gets up from the nurse's station and walks into the hospital room. Jimmy follows her to the door and peers in.

dialogues.text: Laurie is on the bed. Motionless. Mrs. Alves checks the I.V. Doctor sits in a chair holding his head.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: -.. and keep checking her. She ought to be coming around any time now.

dialogues.text: Well go zet her. She forgot to call Laurie's parents.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ALVES

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE

KIDS throw rocks and bricks at the house. MEN stand on the sidewalk drinking beer. And then YELLING and throwing the cans. Another Highway Patrol car pulls up. Two OFFICERS get out and start restoring order.

dialogues.text: Empty. Plus, we covered the whole east end of town, Gary. Nothing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: He just ain't there.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: Cover it again. The patrolmen walk away. Loomis and Hunt turn to watch the other officers struggling against the YELLING, angry crowd.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: (continuing) Haddonfield was a pretty quiet town until tonight. The only shots fired around here were to start the track meet at the high school. Loomis turns and looks at the Myers house. He pulls a pack of cigarettes out of his pocket. Taps one out of the pack. Then feels his trench coat for matches.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: But there was one night in 1963. The night Michael Myers murdered his sister. In that upstairs bedroom. With a large butcher's knife.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: I remember. I was sixteen years old. Hunt reaches in his pocket and takes out a BIC lighter. He hands it to Loomis. Loomis lights his cigarette. Offers the lighter back to Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: (continuing) Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: It was on Halloween night. It's his anniversary, Mister Hunt. He's come back.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: After fifteen years? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: He waited with extraordinary patience. There was a forte inside him biding its time. The staff grew accustomed to his immobility and silence. To them he was the perfect patient. He never spoke, he never cried, he never moved. He just waited. The staff was unprepared. They didn't know what he was.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG

dialogues.text: He had this stupid mask on... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: 172 “CONTINUED: (3) 172

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold and sterile tiles. In the center of the room is the whirlpool. It is big enough for four to six patients. All around the whirlpool are exercise machines and walking bars. At one end of the room is a glass-enclosed area. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: Budd sits in the whirlpool. Bubbles swirl around him. Karen enters the room. She leaves the door open just a little. ‘

dialogues.speaker: BUDD

dialogues.text: I don't want to wrinkle my uniform.
Budd dunks his head underwater and comes up.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE GLASS-ENCLOSED ROOM 175
dialogues.text: Inside the control room. Through the steamy glass we SEE Budd in the whirlpool. We hear no sound from the therapy room. A second later Karen's naked form moves. from the dressing area to the tub. She slides into the bubbling water. - \ Then Budd and Karen embrace in the tub. Laugh. Splash water on each other, In total silence. CAMERA PULLS BACK SLIGHTLY. Standing behind the glass in the shadows is the shape. Slowly, carefully he moves. CAMERA FOLLOWS his hand. He reaches to a temperature gauge. It reads: 104. His hand turns up the gauge.

dialogues.speaker: ON BUDD AND KAREN 176

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: In order to appease the Gods, the Druid priests held fire rituals. Prisoners of war, the insane, criminals, animals were burned alive in baskets. By observing the way they died the Druids believed they could see omens of the future. Two thousand years, later we've come. no further. It isn't evil spirits. Not ghosts nor goblins nor witches. Samhain is the unconscious mind. We're all afraid of the dark inside ourselves. \ Marion grabs Loomis. She pulls on his sleeve. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: They were hidden, sealed by the court after his parents were killed. When the Governor heard what had happened tonight, he authorized Dr. Rogers to open it.

dialogues.text: (continuing; whispers) It's not fair. They should have ' allowed you to examine everything. That girl, that Strode girl... She's Michael Myers' sister! - She was born two years after he was committed. The parents died four years later and she was adopted by the Strodes. They requested the records sealed to protect the family.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS

dialogues.speaker: ON LAURIE 416
dialogues.text: We can just see her eyes. Glistening in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: ON DOOR .
dialogues.text: Slowly the door swings open. A shaft of light spills in from the operating room. And then the shape appears in the doorway. Moving slowly into the room! Loomis jumps out! He points his gun at the shape's face and pulls the trigger!

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )
o- 417° CONTINUED: ' 4LT Le? CLICK! The gun is empty! Loomis has forgotten to reload!

dialogues.speaker: ON LOOMIS 419
dialogues.text: He staggers back against a bed, knocking it over, and CRASHES to the floor! His gun goes flying!

dialogues.speaker: ON SHAPE 420
dialogues.text: He starts toward Laurie. 421 ON LAURIE Waa She shrinks back into the corner. Suddenly, she sees the gun on the floor. She grabs it. Holding it with both hands, her back against the wall, she aims it at the advancing shape. And fires twice!

dialogues.speaker: ON SHAPE 422
dialogues.text: He lurches and staggers back, holding his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ON LOOMIS 423
dialogues.text: Lying on.the floor. Unable to move, to reach his gun. All he can do is watch the shape.

dialogues.speaker: LOOMIS
dialogues.text: Die, damn you! Die! 424 ON SHAPE , Hau Still clutching his eyes, he turns again in the direction of Loomis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

There's still some smoke drifting. And water all over the parking lot. CAMERA MOVES TO Hunt standing by his squad car. He looks broken. Grim. A PATROLMEN comes up to him.

dialogues.text: What's the count?

dialogues.text: Eight. The Patrolmen walks away. CAMERA MOVES FROM Hunt to Laurie, wrapped in a blanket, being led to an ambulance by TWO MEDICS. One of them opens the back door.

dialogues.text: Laurie starts to climb into the back of the ambulance. INT. AMBULANCE Was Dark and seemingly empty. Laurie climbs in. The doors close. , Suddenly, a shape sits right up into frame behind her! She screams.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHAPE 446
dialogues.text: It's Jimmy. His head bound round and round in white gauze.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Laurie, it's me! It's okay! ON LAURIE 4b7 She heaves a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: God, you nearly scared me to death!

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Sorry. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. (a beat) We made it, Jimmy. She reaches out and touches his hand. He closes it around hers. . Laurie turns and takes a last long look at the clinic. Then she lies down on the stretcher next to Jimmy. Gently, he puts his arm around her. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can lie down. I can go to sleep now. . CAMERA MOVES IN on her face. FADE TO BLACK. ROLL END CREDITS.
